SENT.plain: Severe diarrhoea in patients with the acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS) is usually a manifestation of gastrointestinal infection by a variety of organisms
We report a patient with low CD4 T cell counts who developed ulcerative colitis after amoebic dysentery
He subsequently developed acute ulcerative colitis with toxic dilatation while he was severely immunocompromised
He responded to corticosteroids and mesalazine and remains well on maintenance therapy
